programme.title: Spiky Gold Hunters
programme.desc: The crew of the San Nicholas head into icy waters and cold conditions. Competition between the divers is fierce, but for one member of the team it will be their last trip..

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: A lumber truck collides with a diesel tanker, resulting in a raging fire and the biggest job of Colin's career. Other recovery drivers struggle in the face of severe rain and snow.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Frank and Mike talk their way into a salvage yard that has not been picked over for decades.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The curators of the Nascar Hall of Fame challenge Frank and Mike to find as much motor racing memorabilia as they can.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: While Rygaard tries to come to terms with a devastating loss, Shelby is rushed to casualty, giving Browning the opportunity to take advantage of its rival's misfortune.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: It's an all-out fight to the finish as the season draws to a close. As the junior pilot attempts to save things for Connor, Joe makes James an offer he can't refuse.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick Dale finds a barber's chair from the 1940s, and a client brings in a rare 1950s drinks machine.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: A Vegas Pawn Star hauls in a crumbling 1957 Chevy 150 for a much-needed restoration. The American Pickers rock up too, hoping to flog some of their vintage valuables..

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts visit an ancient fortress in Peru believed to have been built by aliens using tools far more advanced than those thought to have been available to humans at the time.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate alleged sightings of UFOs during the Black Death, and examine the theory that aliens may have inflicted the disease on the human race.

programme.title: Monster Croc Wrangler
programme.desc: Animal helper Matt Wright and his team take on a dangerous challenge to ensure the survival of the saltwater crocodile. They must gather more than 20,000 unhatched eggs for relocation, but the fiercely protective reptilian mothers do not take well to their territory being invaded.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz visit the sites of famous American Civil War battles to unearth valuable and quirky collectibles.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank bid for slot machines, old advertising and bears that have been stuffed and mounted.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: I'd Do Anything for Lesa (But I Won't Do That)
programme.desc: Jenny restores some old furniture, while tensions erupt between her, Lesa and Mary.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers attend fiercely competitive auctions in Garland, where Moe and Mary find a rare historical artefact.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers visit the Dallas suburb of Addison, where the Rangers find a nautical antique and Jenny uncovers a piece of Hollywood memorabilia.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: A locker at an auction in Arlington catches Vic's eye, but Bubba suspects it could have been used for shady dealings.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky and Bubba are cautiously optimistic as they head to auctions in Mesquite, Nevada, a location that has not proven to be particularly fruitful for them in the past.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders go head to head in a series of tense locker auctions in Oak Cliff, where they bid for a unit of antique electronics and a strange vaudeville curio.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi Passante and Jarrod Schulz enter into a fierce battle against rival Dave Hester as they search California's storage units for valuables and forgotten jewels.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers travel to the latest set of auctions in Fullerton, California, where Jarrod and Brandi compete for a storage unit they need to keep their store afloat.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers are far from home and get the opportunity to find out who has the skills for the job and who is just relying on luck.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell takes a gamble on a locker completely covered with blankets, while Brandi makes a risky decision.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell finds a box of old books, Jarrod and Brandi battle for a unit filled with classic signs, and Barry takes a chance on a mystery trunk.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi uncover what appears to be an antique wine rack, while Dave and Barry test each other's knowledge of oddities.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers search for hiking and camping gear, and Dave Hester reveals the secrets of auction success.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers travel to Torrance in California, where they bid for a unit containing a classic Jaguar car - but the competition proves stiffer than ever.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Six lockers belonging to one tenant go up for auction as the buyers speculate over the owner's identity.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi and Jarrod argue over the value of a bizarre horse's head. Barry bids for a locker full of antique furniture, and Dave makes his strangest discovery ever.

programme.title: Spiky Gold Hunters
programme.desc: The crew of the San Nicholas head into icy waters and cold conditions. Competition between the divers is fierce, but for one member of the team it will be their last trip..

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: Gus and Will find an Audi Quattro roadster than has seen better days – it’s full of problems, and hasn’t been serviced in years. Clearly they need to buy it..

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: It's a race against the clock as Marty, Rick and the team are blindsided by a shocking development that could spell the end of all Money Pit operations.

programme.title: Mountain Men
programme.desc: When a massive mid-winter storm tears across Alaska, Marty pushes his machine to the limit. Morgan and Margaret race to make the cut before the snow hits.

programme.title: Texas Rising
programme.desc: Emily has used all her powers of seduction to get close to Santa Anna. Braving danger at seducing the Mexican leader, she gathers vital intelligence that will prove an indispensable weapon in the Texans' ongoing pursuit of victory. Drama set during the Texas Revolution, starring Cynthia Addai-Robinson.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More 2018 News for You
programme.desc: An extended compilation of the most memorable news stories of 2018, with captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop, and assorted hosts and special guests from the worlds of comedy, journalism and current affairs.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programme.desc: The comedian provides his take on fatherhood, playing tricks with singing toys, interrogating children's TV characters, and messing with modern Monopoly.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy is always looking for ways of improving her position in the world and sees another chance by befriending posh new neighbours Toby and Anna. But she hasn't reckoned on Lee dragging her right back down to earth. Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star in the sitcom, with guest appearances from Hugh Dennis and Abigail Cruttenden.

programme.title: Alan Davies: As Yet Untitled
programme.desc: Stand-up comic and QI panellist Alan Davies is joined in conversation by Melanie C, Jamali Maddix, Jessica Knappett and Ardal O'Hanlon.

programme.title: Alan Davies: As Yet Untitled
programme.desc: David Baddiel joins Alan to relive the glory days of Euro ‘96, while Sindhu Vee, Elis James and Beattie Edmondson discuss celebrities and B&Bs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Joy of Techs
programme.desc: Alexis Conran tries to persuade Marcus Brigstocke that a hi-tech camper van, a sheep-herding drone and a quad-bike jet-ski hybrid will improve a road trip around the Lake District.

programme.title: The Joy of Techs
programme.desc: Alexis Conran makes one last attempt to modernise Marcus Brigstocke, invading his country cottage to show off hybrid cars and self-watering plant-pots.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson heads to Italy to get behind the wheel of the exclusive, hand-crafted Alfa Romeo Disco Volante, which is made by coachbuilder Touring Superleggera and based on the manufacturer's already rare 8C Competizione sports car. Richard Hammond asserts authority over the sand dunes of Abu Dhabi in the six-wheel-drive Mercedes-Benz G63 AMG 6x6, while James May defies his status as Captain Slow by blasting two Caterhams around the test track - the minimalist entry-level Seven 160 and the full-fat supercharged Seven 620R. Comedian Jack Whitehall sets a lap time in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Ultimate Movers
programme.desc: A crane must be moved from Bristol's Avonmouth Dock and, in Immingham, tonnes of fresh fish has to be delivered intact and on time to Grimsby's famous fish market.

programme.title: Steve Austin's Broken Skull Challenge
programme.desc: The former wrestler challenges eight contestants to triumph over a series of gruelling physical endurance tests.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Police officers investigate an attack on a pizza delivery driver and find a woman sleeping in the garden of an abandoned house.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: A succession of knifings leaves the police facing a potential double murder investigation. The team raid the house of a suspected drug dealer and discover weapons.

programme.title: Drug Wars
programme.desc: Border Patrol agents in Ajo, Arizona spread out to patrol one of the most dangerous drug routes in the Southwestern United States.

programme.title: Drug Wars
programme.desc: Border Patrol's elite tactical unit, BORTAC, seeks to capture a group of traffickers who are determined to move their drugs through the desert.

programme.title: Aussie Pickers
programme.desc: Series following two pickers, Lucas Callaghan and Adam McDonald, who earn a living by restoring forgotten relics to their former glory, beginning with a visit to a junkyard.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike is torn when he comes across a 100-year-old motorbike that he desperately wants, but which he knows is overpriced.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Chat-show host Jonathan Ross, former England cricket captain Michael Vaughan and comedienne Sara Pascoe tell Frank Skinner what really gets on their wick, in the hope he will banish their bugbears to the infamous room for ever. The celebrities' gripes include pick 'n' mix, misuse of the word 'literally' and the Grim Reaper.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: TV doctor Christian Jessen, actor and presenter Warwick Davis and writer and broadcaster Victoria Coren Mitchell tell Frank Skinner what really gets on their wick, in the hope he will banish their bugbears to the infamous room for ever. The celebrities' gripes include doctors, James Bond and people who send e-mails.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner introduces a look back at some of the best bits from the series, plus a few hitherto unseen clips. Topics nominated for consignment to oblivion include dabbing, people who love the outdoors and The Archers.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the offbeat event from Montreal, Canada where replicas of a DeLorean and the Ghostbusters' Ecto-1 are among the vehicles taking part in the downhill race.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Officers become suspicious when they pull over a businessman from Mexico who is making a rare journey to the United States in a brand new car.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Suspicions are raised when a routine x-ray reveals suspicious packages hidden inside the tyres of a pick-up truck. Officers also seize a large shipment of marijuana.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Comedian Katherine Ryan takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz, with comedy writer Andy Hamilton and stand-up and actress Cariad Lloyd joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Jenny Eclair, Johnny Vegas and Bill Bailey join regular panellist Alan Davies for an extended edition of the quiz show, in which Stephen Fry awards points for the answers he finds most interesting - regardless of whether they are correct. This time, the Stephen Fry prepares for the festive period with some seasonal merriment.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Mancunian stand-up Jason Manford hosts the comedy show from the world-famous Hammersmith Apollo, and invites observational comic Michael McIntyre to take to the stage.

programme.title: David Jason: Planes, Trains and Automobiles
programme.desc: The actor continues his American journey in dramatic fashion, riding a Wild West stagecoach and vintage locomotive, goes dune buggy do-lally and launches an impressive rocket.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Nato's Airborne Warning and Control System, known as Awac, a cutting-edge aircraft with a huge radar dome mounted on its roof that enables pilots to spot hostile intrusion as they protect state borders of the countries in the Nato alliance. One of the most complex surveillance aircrafts in the world, it is able to seek out, locate, and defend against threats - no matter how fast moving or well hidden.

programme.title: Royal Murder Mysteries
programme.sub-title: Albert Victor: The Prince and the Ripper
programme.desc: Sordid speculation dogged the life of Prince Albert Victor, who was even a suspect in the Jack the Ripper case.

programme.title: Graham Hill: Driven
programme.desc: An intimate portrait of motor racing star Graham Hill, who became the only man to win the Formula One World Championship, Indianapolis 500 and Le Mans 24-hour race - but whose reckless streak was to prove his undoing. Among those sharing their memories of the charismatic Englishman are his son Damon - who became Formula One world champion himself in 1996 - and Jackie Stewart.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Jim Clark: The Quiet Champion
programme.desc: Profile of the two-time Formula One champion, who was killed at the height of his career. Featuring rare archive footage from family home-movies, candid interviews with the driver himself and comments by close friends, including Jackie Stewart, who reminisces about their time spent together racing when they were known as Batman and Robin.

programme.title: Prince Philip: The Plot to Make a King
programme.desc: Secret History documentary telling the inside story of the dynastic tensions that were unleashed when Princess Elizabeth, the future queen, fell in love with Prince Philip. It was felt that Philip was rough and ill-mannered - and with the Second World War still fresh in most people's minds, the royal and political elite disliked his German roots. But following the death of King George VI in 1952, the establishment feared a dynastic coup, with the Queen torn between the two sides. The documentary examines the complexities and frustrations of the royal marriage, as the monarch struggled to reconcile the love of her husband with the suspicions of her family and her government.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How the morale of the Third Reich, boosted by Germany's initial military successes, was shattered by the devastating defeat at Stalingrad, relentless Allied bombing raids and an attempt on Hitler's life. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Laurence Olivier narrates the story of the D-Day landings in June 1944, when the Allies launched the biggest ever amphibious invasion on the beaches of Normandy. Although both sides suffered heavy casualties, it proved to be the turning point in the war against Germany.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Nazi occupation of Holland, which began relatively peacefully with Dutch civil servants continuing to run their own country, but eventually resulted in many thousands of deaths through the attempted elimination of Jewish citizens and starvation of the non-Jewish inhabitants. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Laurence Olivier narrates an account of the liberation of Paris and Brussels in 1944, events which to many signified the end of the war. However, as the German forces retreated, Poland fell victim to one of the most tragic events of the war, Documentary chronicling the Second World War.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The story of the Nazi quest to establish an Aryan race, which set out to subjugate the Jewish population with decrees and laws about citizenship and escalated to the use of execution camps and the horrors of the Holocaust. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Mathewsons agree to sell a vintage threshing machine and large collection of tractors, but extracting them from old barns on a Yorkshire farm proves a bigger job than anticipated.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A Cold War Soviet classic goes under the hammer. Built like a tank, the Moskovitch gets few admirers for style, but finds a loving home with a fan of Eastern Bloc classics.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek collects a Jaguar Mark 2 and explains why they made such poor getaway cars for 1960s bank robbers. A customer considers a Morris Marina as a Christmas present for his wife.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: The team is under pressure with a record number of cars to auction, but Derek finds room for one more - a replica AC Cobra. A couple are reunited with their Volvo breakdown truck.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.sub-title: John Christie: Serial Killer - Part Two
programme.desc: Conclusion of the two-part profile of John Christie, looking at how his crimes were blamed on an innocent man, who was sentenced to death.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Nicholas Day investigates a horrifying discovery made in a Brighton left luggage office in 1934 - which was soon followed by a similar suspicious incident in London.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: The crimes of Henri Landru, who targeted lonely and vulnerable women during the First World War. He seduced them with promises of marriage and lured them to houses outside Paris where the women vanished. With the police uninterested in investigating the disappearances, two women took it upon themselves to pursue Landru.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Rene is told he must recover the paintings from the Communist Resistance headquarters, so he disguises himself as a Franciscan vicar and sets off with Mimi in a pram, disguised as a baby. Meanwhile, Helga is heading to the same place pushing another pram containing Herr Flick. Comedy, starring Gorden Kaye.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Rene and Leclerc escape from the Communist Resistance, the Colonel, Gruber, Bertorelli and Leclerc are held ransom by Denise, and Michelle takes advantage of the situation.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Rene attempts to send an urgent message to London via the transmitter under his twin brother's tomb - but ends up getting carried away. Wartime comedy, starring Gorden Kaye, Carmen Silvera and Vicki Michelle.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: The team is under pressure with a record number of cars to auction, but Derek finds room for one more - a replica AC Cobra. A couple are reunited with their Volvo breakdown truck.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The underground base with the power to destroy a nation, the site linked with an attempt to kill a vicious dictator, and an ancient world discovered in the open American wilderness.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: Kavanagh defends a left-wing activist accused of murdering someone from the opposite end of the political spectrum - and learns a harsh lesson in the process. To make matters worse, he finds out daughter Kate is having an affair with her married tutor, thus setting the scene for further fireworks. John Thaw stars.

programme.title: Cadfael
programme.desc: The 12th-century sleuth sets out to clear his novice Oswin of murdering a nun whose body has been found frozen in a block of ice. While tracking down the culprit, he is also forced to confront the fact he fathered a son before he took holy orders. Medieval mystery based on the novels of Ellis Peters, starring Derek Jacobi, Mark Charnock, Eoin McCarthy and Julian Firth.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward returns to Barton House in Warwickshire to talk to its owners about the work involved in creating their 12-acre site, which is opening for a few days as part of the National Gardens Scheme.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits Gawsworth Hall in Cheshire - one of the participants in the National Gardens Scheme - which features an Elizabethan wilderness area.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the stunning Rowden Gardens on Dartmoor - one of the participants in the National Gardens Scheme.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: Dr Cameron's work at the German PoW camp brings him into conflict with one of the prisoners, while Janet fears Dr Finlay's affection for a married patient could jeopardise his career. Medical drama, starring David Rintoul, Ian Bannen and Annette Crosbie.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gabriel learns Smithy reported him over Kerry's rape allegation and the two come to blows - but retribution comes from an unexpected source when the corrupt copper is gunned down by the Sun Hill sniper. Elsewhere, suspicion falls on Shirley after Yvonne's niece accidentally swallows an Ecstasy tablet, Ramani fears Terry is letting his personal preoccupations interfere with his police work, and a shamefaced Jim tells his colleagues that June has left him.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: New recruit PC Leela Kapoor proves her mettle on her first day at Sun Hill, but the exposure of a dark secret from her past sours her working relationship with Sheelagh. Jim contemplates stepping outside the law to pay off his gambling debts, while another shooting by the serial sniper leads to an influx of armed officers - one of whom, Sergeant Mark Rollins, just happens to be Lance's boyfriend.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jim sinks to a new low when he pawns valuable police evidence to raise the cash he needs to pay off his gambling debts - then promptly blows the lot on a horse. Andrea refuses to abandon her undercover assignment even though Adam is getting uncomfortably close to the truth. Smithy finds the sniper's rifle and it appears to be only a matter of time before the culprit is finally caught - but not everything is as it seems.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: A road traffic accident turns into a drugs investigation when a quantity of cocaine is found in the crashed vehicle. The driver is dead, but Yvonne is more interested in his passenger, none other than Shirley Moss, who's suffered two broken legs. However, when she begins to question the errant teenager about her continued involvement in drugs, Yvonne soon has reason to believe the youngster isn't the architect of her own downfall - especially after the PC's sister, Beverley, is spotted entering a dealer's flat being staked out by Ken and Suzie. Elsewhere, Mark is upset that his colleagues in SO19 have discovered he is gay, but with the secret now out he throws caution to the wind and decides to take his relationship with Lance one step further - it looks like Sun Hill is about to witness its first gay wedding. With romance in the air, the Christmas party gets into full swing, and new girl Amber certainly enjoys herself - and causes much gossip - by very publicly kissing one of the barm.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: The sleuthing housewife investigates a spiritualist who appears to be blackmailing her customers, while Geoffrey falls in love, but his secret romance threatens to undermine Hetty's carefully laid trap - and nearly causes him to quit the agency.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.sub-title: A Rose by Any Other Name
programme.desc: A middle-aged widow's family become convinced a photographer is only marrying her for money and ask Hetty to investigate. Given a week to probe his past and find out whether he's a gold-digging cad or a 24-carat gentleman, the unlikely sleuth unearths some extremely interesting facts. Drama based on the novel by David Cook, starring Patricia Routledge and Derek Benfield.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Rag Nymph
programme.desc: Feature-length period melodrama set in Victorian times, charting the relationship between feisty Newcastle rag-woman Aggie Winkowski and 10-year-old orphan Millie Forester. Determined to protect Millie from the seamy world of prostitution, Aggie resolves to take the youngster under her wing. Starring Honeysuckle Weeks, Perdita Weeks, Val McLane, Alec Newman, Crispin Bonham-Carter and Patrick Ryecart.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns and midwives of Nonnatus House return, with new nurse Barbara, who is anxious to prove herself - only to get off on the wrong foot after a late-night drinks party. A family of severely neglected children is discovered, so Trixie strives to restore their health and bring happiness into their lives, leaving Tom filled with admiration for the woman he loves, while Sister Evangelina finally undergoes tests for her abdominal pains. Shelagh finds she is at the surgery almost as much as she is at home, so the Turners come up with a solution which, for 1960, proves somewhat ground-breaking.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Barbara faces her most challenging case so far when she treats a first-time mother, only for the birth not to go according to plan. A new nurse arrives and soon makes an impression on Sister Evangelina, while Sister Julienne is worried about the increasing financial pressure on Nonnatus House, but doesn't bank on a mystery benefactor coming to the rescue. Jenny Agutter and Pam Ferris star, with Linda Bassett (East Is East) joining the cast.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The squad reinvestigates the death of a timeshare magnate, previously thought to have committed suicide, when a reformed call girl claims she was with him the night he died and saw someone force their way into his house as she left. It then emerges the deceased's widow has since fallen on hard times after being swindled by her late husband's business partner - who is connected to a notorious criminal. Guest starring Shane Richie, Naomi Bentley and Claire Rushbrook.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Nikki, Jack, Thomas and Clarissa are just settling down for their respective Christmas Day celebrations when they are called in to investigate a shooting spree at an enormous property owned by Andy McMorris, the CEO of a haulage company. Emilia Fox stars.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Boyd learns he is being removed from the Cold Case unit. For his final job, he re-opens an investigation into the disappearance of 16 homeless teenagers between 1979 and 1982 - the first case he ever worked on. However, as the team struggles to find any new information, Grace worries about her colleague's reasons for revisiting his past - while a guilt-ridden Sarah becomes desperate to make amends for her role in Boyd's sacking. First part of the crime drama's two-part final story, starring Trevor Eve, with Paul McGann.

programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.desc: Update on the day's headlines, plus a weather report.

programme.desc: Sky News documentary special meeting people in Ukraine who were involved in the Chernobyl nuclear disaster in 1986.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Rock Brock becomes the target of an angry elf after he breaks his magic cauldron during a battle with a ferocious dragon - or so he says.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: When a popular vlogger gets trapped during an avalanche, International Rescue must find a way to carefully dig him out.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Can Danny handle the pressure of performing basketball tricks in front of hundreds of fans and avoid the messy forfeit?.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Tom and Jerry investigate the case of a missing pineapple in Hawaii.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Toodles the Witch mesmerizes Tom in a haunted castle and poses a threat to Jerry and Tuffy.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Madcap slapstick and mayhem as the celebrated cat and mouse plot against each other.

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: As Fizz gets ready to travel to another dimension populated entirely by other Fizzes, Magoo turns up and thinks that Weasel has a new kitten..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean pimps his car in order to prove to Declan - a rival in love - that Bean's car is better..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Instructed to keep an eye on Gran while the rest of the Spuds visit to the doctor, Dave finds that she has escaped..

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda: The Paws of Destiny
programme.desc: Po discovers that he has been poisoned and sets off to find who is behind it, while the students follow him in secret..

programme.title: Craig of the Creek
programme.desc: Craig of the Creek follows a young boy and his two friends as they go on adventures in a world of untamed, kid-dominated wilderness in the creek.

programme.title: Ainsley's Caribbean Kitchen
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott takes a tour of Tobago, where he puts his own spin on some local recipes, including hand clapped rotis, dougla rum chicken, mustard fish and mango chili chow, and a bluewater breeze cocktail. He also helps Charlottesville fishermen to bring in the day's catch and takes a relaxing boat trip to the Nylon Pool.

programme.title: Living on the Veg
programme.desc: Henry Firth and Ian Theasby serve up crispy party poppers with barbecue dipping sauce - ideal for movie nights - a breakfast burrito, aubergine curry and banana bread doughnuts. They are also joined by Prue Leith, who tucks into their mushroom wellington.

programme.title: The Greek Islands with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Known as the Paradise Islands, the Sporades' lush pine forests and coastlines are simply breathtaking. On Skiathos, Julia boards a fishing boat in search of a secret world of hidden coves and deserted beaches. Heading inland, she visits the hillside Monastery of Evangelistria, one of Greece's most important religious sites, before island-hopping to neighbouring Skopelos for a taste of marriage, Greek style. After trying on the island's traditional wedding dress, her trip ends at the tiny Chapel of St John.

programme.title: Countrywise
programme.desc: Liz Bonnin enjoys one of Britain's National Trails as she walks part of the Thames Path through Oxfordshire - meeting some of the people and animals who call the banks of this impressive river home. Ben Fogle is in Whitby on the North Yorkshire coast to follow one of the nation's favourite dishes - fish and chips - from sea to plate. The programme also catches up with Dales shepherdess Amanda Owen as her family celebrates dad Clive's birthday.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Spinning-chair singing contest, in which celebrity 'coaches' seek out the nation's best vocal talent. But there is a simple twist - with the four coaches selecting their teams through 'blind auditions', looks play no part in the selection process, meaning each singer is chosen on vocal ability alone.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett hosts a special double elimination show, in which two more singers will be unmasked. Sharon and Kelly Osbourne are today's special guests on the panel, joining series regulars Rita Ora, Jonathan Ross and Davina McCall as they attempt to guess the identities of the six famous faces performing from behind bizarre costumes.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Ann Widdecombe, Sam Nixon and Mark Rhodes and Jimmy Carr pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: The celebrities and their professional partners perform fairy-tale routines, hoping to get a high enough score from the judges and viewers to keep them out of the bottom two. Sadly there'll be no happy ever after for Radzi Chinyanganya, who lost the skate-off last week, but while the votes are being counted there will be a routine from Disney on Ice. Presented by Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: Wealthy betting shop tycoon Alun Wilmott is shot and killed during a home invasion, leaving his wife and daughter traumatised - with large amounts of cash missing from his personal safe, it is assumed he is the unlucky victim of a burglary. Vera suspects an inside job in the shape of Alun's head of private security, Ciaran Duggan, whose history of violent crime calls his reformed character into question. Can the team find the evidence to pin the crime on their prime suspect - or are they looking in the wrong place? Brenda Blethyn stars, with guest appearances from Karl Collins, Patrick Robinson and Katy Carmichael.

programme.title: Bradley Walsh & Son: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: The Chase presenter Bradley Walsh and his son Barney return for a second series as they embark on another road trip across America together. This time, the actor and his son arrive in Ohio, where they head for Dayton - the birthplace of aviation - before the pair attend a local rodeo later that evening. Brad soon realises that they are not just there to spectate on the sport, they are also expected to take part. However, a nasty fall from an angry bull means Brad spends the rest of the night in hospital.

programme.title: Six Nations Highlights
programme.desc: England v France. Jill Douglas presents action from both teams' opening match of the championship, which came from Stade de France. The hosts were looking to get off to a winning start under new head coach Fabien Galthie, while England were aiming to build on their run to last year's World Cup final. Plus, action from Wales v Italy at Principality Stadium and Ireland v Scotland at Aviva Stadium. With analysis from Jim Hamilton, Ugo Moyne, Gareth Thomas and Gordon D'Arcy, and commentary by Miles Harrison and Nick Mullins.

programme.title: Liar
programme.desc: Laura travels to Edinburgh to try to uncover the truth behind Andrew's wife's death, but finds more than she bargained for. Meanwhile, tensions between Tom and Katy reach breaking point as their secret threatens to surface. Thriller, starring Joanne Froggatt and Ioan Gruffudd.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Military equipment collector Bruce Crompton takes on a huge project to restore and rebuild a German Panther tank. But to do so he must part with some Second World War 'halftracks'.

programme.title: The Unexplained Files
programme.desc: A derelict school that appears to be haunted by, ‘shadow people', and people in a hillside town report inexplicable sun activity.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini takes his client's rare 1908 Simplex Speedcar roadster to an auction to see what kind of money it will make.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: After chasing one for 38 years, Wayne Carini finally acquired a Hudson Italia from a woman called Hazel, who might have more surprises in store for the enthusiast.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Real-life footage demonstrates what happens when a dog gets behind the wheel. Plus, rowdy races gone wrong, and an incredible dance-off on the highway.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Peculiar pedestrians take to the road, and reckless drivers throw caution in the wind. Plus, dash-cams continue to capture people behaving in inexplicable ways.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A motorcycle stunt ends in a catastrophic fall, a racing boat breaks up, plunging its crew into heavy seas, and a vintage dragster smashes into a wall.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A military jet crashes after breaking up, a man survives being run over by a tractor trailer, and the safety capsule of a dragboat flies open during a crash.

programme.title: Goblin Works Garage
programme.desc: The team takes on one of Europe's fastest growing car markets, visiting Albania to convert a vintage saloon into an off-road beast.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: The mechanics are called in by a man who would like them to fix his son's 1969 Mustang, after he had difficulty paying for the repairs.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole gives Simon O'Brien a motorcycling masterclass in Wiltshire as the duo seek more items to fix up and sell on to make profits for their owners.

programme.title: Supercar Superbuild
programme.desc: A profile of the F-Type Jaguar, which has been designed as a pure sports car, and engineered for high performance and responsive road handling.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado Drew Pritchard teams up with Turbo Pickers' Paul Cowland for a motoring mission. They scour the UK, buying, restoring and selling classic cars.

programme.title: Goblin Works Garage
programme.desc: The team takes on one of Europe's fastest growing car markets, visiting Albania to convert a vintage saloon into an off-road beast.

programme.title: EFL on Quest
programme.desc: A round-up of goals and highlights from the English Football League, including Leeds United v Wigan Athletic and West Bromwich Albion v Luton Town.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Rookies battle broken hoses and finally hit treasure. Meanwhile, at their wash plant, the Cooke Brothers race to beat the worst drought in a decade.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Rookies Justin and Becky risk their lives underground, desperate for a find. Meanwhile, opal hunting legend Col Duff returns on the hunt for long-forgotten treasure.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Fire Crew's season rests on a knife-edge as they battle their way back from a disastrous setback. The Opal Queen battles rock hard walls alone, desperate to find opal.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Rookie Justin tackles a deal that could make or break him. The Boulder Boys race to save their claim from a monsoon flood, while the Cooke Brothers finally make a valuable discovery.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Huge waves test rookie skipper Josh, but it is fire not water that threatens to sink his Cornelia Marie. On the Wizard, a mutinous crew faces off with Captain Keith.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys a cheap BMW M5 in a terrible condition, and Edd China has his work cut out trying to rejuvenate the dilapidated vehicle so it can turn a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer searches for a Renault Alpine 310 in France, but mechanic Edd China finds the car holds some surprises when he tries to fix it up.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole gives Simon O'Brien a motorcycling masterclass in Wiltshire as the duo seek more items to fix up and sell on to make profits for their owners.

programme.title: Born Mucky: Life on the Farm
programme.desc: A one-ton bull causes problems for Ian as he attempts to grow his cattle herd. Plus, a potentially disastrous barn fire keeps Tom and Joe alert as they stack the hay harvest.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: In Margate, Kent, Drew Pritchard snaps up a good deal at a 'junk emporium' run by some of his best contacts. At a Georgian mansion in Fife, he finds a surprising bargain.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard heads to Edinburgh, where he discovers an antique shop with a deluxe 1940s American bike. Later, he finds a mid-century designer desk in Wookey Hole.

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: The investigators are given a chance to explore a mysterious Nazi complex in the Argentinean jungle, and head to Berlin to examine evidence that Hitler could have faked his death.

programme.title: Busting the Drugs Millions: Inside the National Crime Agency
programme.desc: Documentary following one of the National Crime Agency's largest money laundering investigations. The programme examines how a team of officers began by carrying out surveillance on one man, whom they believed to be involved in a criminal conspiracy. However, as the evidence began to mount, they were able to bring down one of the largest illegal networks in British history.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: A woman identifies a dead body as her missing sister Annie - but Annie is still alive.

programme.title: Copycat Killers
programme.desc: How, in a crime that shocked Florida, a 14-year-old schoolboy obsessed with fictional killer Hannibal Lecter turned his violent fantasy into reality when he killed a classmate.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of Patricia Kimmi, who disappeared from her home in Horton, Kansas, in November 2009. Roger Hollister, an acquaintance of the victim's husband, was later convicted of murder after his wife led detectives to a piece of land where skeletal human remains were unearthed and confirmed to be Kimmi's.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Agents discover a sordid trail of drugs, hitmen and murder as they try to solve the kidnapping of 16-year-old Lisa Rene.

programme.title: Animal Cops
programme.desc: The detectives rescue a German shepherd covered from head to toe in bloodsucking ticks. Series drawing on cases from NYC, Houston, Detroit and Phoenix.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A dog gets hit by a car, pooch Ava eats a G-string, a distressed mother loses her joey and a canine gets hung out of a window upside-down.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: Here Comes the Bride Again - and Again
programme.desc: Keasha bonds with cancer survivor Jennifer during the search for a dress, and a bad-tempered bride takes her frustrations out on Vera.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Patti Ann makes the trip all the way from Chicago to find the right dress for her Bahamas wedding, while Merav has budget issues when she starts looking for her gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A bride brings her father with her when she chooses a wedding dress, while another customer realises that the time has finally come to tell her dad that she has a tattoo.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Sydney veterinary surgeon Dr Chris Brown feels the pressure when he comes to the aid of a distressed Sumatran tiger with a tooth problem.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: When Boris the Staffy was born he had a cleft palate, and Chris attempts a type of complex surgery that has never been performed in the country before to help save his life.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: At over 600lbs each, Vianey and Allen are in a co-dependent relationship based on a shared love of food. However, they are both determined to conquer their food addiction together.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Ashley is desperate for skin surgery but is not losing any weight, and after being evicted, Nicole moves back to Ohio, which could affect her weight-loss journey.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride is upset when her bridesmaid does not fit into her dress, while another searches for a gown for her wedding party of 22 people.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride fights with her groom's sister over the choice of dress, and another upsets her bridesmaids with her lack of style.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride fights with her mother who wants the bridesmaids to look like pink ballerinas, while a woman tries to avoid a war by letting her party pick their own dresses.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Caressa Cameron who was crowned Miss America 2010 arrives to select bridesmaid dresses for her five-star wedding, but the pressure becomes too much for one of her party.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A would-be bride struggles to convince her exotic-dancer sister to choose a dress suitable for a church wedding, and a pushy mother-of-the-bride ruins her daughter's appointment.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Tensions run high between a bride and her demanding wedding planner, and the youngest sibling of a large family fights for her right to be heard and stands up to her sisters.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Two women compete to be named maid of honour, and a bride struggles to wrestle control of her big day from a groomsmaid intent on stealing the spotlight.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A would-be-bride tries to find dresses that will fit her voluptuous bridesmaids, while another battles with her sister, who is determined to wear a tiara to the wedding.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride faces a power struggle with her sister over the colour of the bridesmaids' dresses, while another makes big plans for a memorable second trip down the aisle.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride drops a bombshell which leaves one of her wedding party in tears. Meanwhile, another bride fights her mother over the choice of dress.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The team pulls out all the stops to save a newborn foal when it is found with its abandoned mother.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Animal cruelty investigator Barbara Christiansen rescues a horse found lying in a pool of water after heavy rain.

programme.title: Long Lost Family Australia
programme.desc: Chrissie Swan and Anh Do help 36-year-old mother-of-four Emma find her birth father Ken. Plus, assistance is offered to 27-year-old Sian Cavanagh, who is looking for her half-sister Alana.

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: A case from May 1997, when eight-year-old Jamie Lavis was on the Manchester bus Darren Vickers was driving just prior to his disappeance. Vickers joined the hunt and spoke on television - but was hiding an awful truth. Bones from Jamie's torso were eventually found hidden in bushes on a golf course five months later, and evidence led detectives back to the driver.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: JT is almost 900lbs with a 100-lb lymphedema mass on his leg and a dangerous food addiction. When his girlfriend takes him to Houston, his behaviour drives her away.
